definitions: To experience a difficult or unpleasant situation.
To examine something carefully, often in a detailed way.
To use up or consume something completely.
To be officially approved or accepted.
To perform or complete a task or process.
examples: She had to go through a lot of pain during recovery.
Let's go through the report one more time.
We went through all our savings on that trip.
The new policy will go through next month.
He went through the entire procedure without a hitch.
